product_name: La Roche-PosayEffaclar Purifying Foaming Gel Cleanser for Oily Skin
summary: SummaryHighlightsVeganHSA/FSA eligibleLa Roche-Posay Effaclar Purifying Foaming Gel Cleanser for Oily Skin gently cleanses impurities while respecting skin's pH balance.
details: DetailsBenefitsLa Roche-Posay Foaming face cleanser gently cleanses oily skinSuitable for sensitive & acne prone skinNon-comedogenicDermatologist TestedKey IngredientsZinc Pidolate, known for its purifying properties to help remove excess oilLa Roche-Posay Thermal Spring Water, a soothing water sourced in the town of La Roche-Posay in France and a core ingredient in most of our productsFormulated WithoutOilAlcoholItem 2620365How To UseStep 1: Morning and/or evening, massage onto wet skin in a gentle, circular motion.Step 2: Rinse thoroughly and pat dryIngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Sodium Laureth Sulfate, Peg-8, Coco-Betaine, Hexylene Glycol, Sodium Chloride, Peg-120 Methyl Glucose Dioleate, Zinc Pca, Sodium Hydroxide, Citric Acid, Sodium Benzoate, Phenoxyethanol, Caprylyl Glycol, Parfum/Fragrance.
how_to_use: Step 1: Morning and/or evening, massage onto wet skin in a gentle, circular motion.Step 2: Rinse thoroughly and pat dry

reviews.headline: Effective Cleanser for Oily Skin Only
reviews.comments: Great for oily skin like me. It cleans thoroughly, but follow up with a hydrating moisturizer. Not for dry or normal skin; this isn't a one-size-fits-all on all skin types. If you have sensitive skin, avoid. Best cleanser I've used.

reviews.headline: Wanted to love, smell was awful.
reviews.comments: I love most if not all La Roche Posay products.  But this one, the scent is awful.  I tried it a few times, i liked the clean feel after using it, but the smell of the product is not pleasant. Such a bummer.

reviews.headline: Dried my skin out
reviews.comments:
I was looking forward to this product as I have oily skin, but within a few uses, my skin became extremely dry and patchy which hasn't happed with the other La Roche Posay face wash that I've used many times before. 

I'd recommend sticking to the other oily skin facial cleanser because this one is way too harsh.

reviews.headline: wanted to love this but didn't
reviews.comments: Just a week after using this my skin broke out like crazy. At first I thought it was my skin getting used to a new cleanser but this was not the case. I really wanted to love this product but unfortunately I do not and ill be going back to my old cleanser.

reviews.headline: Broke me out like never before
reviews.comments: I have oily skin and struggle a lot with acne, however I've rarely suffered any breakouts from skincare products I've tried in the past. This product was the exception. After using it for a week or so I started experiencing the most painful breakout above my lips (area right under my nose). The pimples even came in clusters!! It was horrible, and as soon as I stopped using this specific product and went back to my previous cleanser my face cleared up. Not to mention the smell was also disgusting. Will never purchase again :(

reviews.headline: Not good
reviews.comments: I have really oily skin, but this made my skin really dry. It says it's fragrance free, but it have fragrance in it and its super strong which made me break out

reviews.headline: Good for oily skin...
reviews.comments:
I've read a few reviews and there's quite a bit of people complaining about the scent of this product. I personally like the smell, it's a fresh clean scent and doesn't seem so strong to me, so I don't understand what people are complaining about? 
I have oily skin, larger pores, not sensitive, and also not sensitive to scents and this product worked well for me. I love the consistency of the gel as well and the amount of product will last me a long time. Overall, I would buy again.
I wouldn't recommend for sensitive, dry skinned people. It might be too strong.

reviews.headline: Super drying and smell too strong
reviews.comments: I have been a huge fan of this line, but the specific cleanser made my skin irritated because of fragrance. I have an oily skin And for somehow, I made it much more earlier in a long run

reviews.headline: Does what it's supposed to
reviews.comments: Im giving this a 4 star only for the fact that the scent is so pungent. If you can get past that, this is an amazing cleanser for oily skin. It lives up to its claims. I would recommend this. However, if you are on the drier side, this is not for you.

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: It works and smells good. Buy it

reviews.headline: Loveeeeee
reviews.comments: This is the best cleaner they have for combination skin in my opinion!! Get any kind of grime off snd you feel sqeaky clean without drying the skin out!

reviews.headline: Loveeeeee
reviews.comments: This is the best cleaner they have for combination skin in my opinion!! Get any kind of grime off snd you feel sqeaky clean without drying the skin out!

reviews.headline: It's great
reviews.comments: This is my favorite face wash, I'm 41 and people always think I'm in my 20's.  My secret is this face wash and a very basic skin care routine.  Less is definitely more in skin careâ€¦

reviews.headline: Scented/Fragrance
reviews.comments: This is a scented cleanser so if you have sensitive skin, it's not the right cleanser for you! I was surprised bc all my other La Roche products do not have fragrance and work great on my skin.

reviews.headline: Nice cleanser
reviews.comments: My combination oily skin enjoys this cleanser. Foams nicely with light scent. It is a gentle cleanser so I go in with a clarifying lotion after.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: works so well on my sensitive combination skin

reviews.headline: I like it so far
reviews.comments: I have combination but very sensitive, acne prone skin. I love the lather and how clean it makes my skin feel. It has a slight burn to it which I don't love, but I don't know if that's my sensitive skin or if I just need to get used to it.

reviews.headline: i would not buy this
reviews.comments: um didn't like the smell, it smelt like cow doodoo tbh

reviews.headline: SMELL
reviews.comments: Wish i wouldve loved this product because i have heard so many good things but the smell was tooooo strong for me. A very heavy moth ball smell that would not allow me to even use the product.

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: Makes my skin super soft and the scent is barely noticeable but nice. Very nice foaming and cleaning feeling. Recommend it

media.headline: Effective Cleanser for Oily Skin Only
media.caption: Bottle, one month usage

faceoff_positive.comments: I started using this cleanser after running out of my regular one, and so far it has not disappointed me. My skin feels clean, but not squeaky clean, after using the cleanser, although it takes me a while to foam it. It lathers well but doesn't foam a lot from my experience. If I have a pimple, this cleanser will help diminishing it in several days. In the fall, the cleanser feels okay after using, but in the winter, my dry areas (my cheeks) can turn very dry after using the cleanser, so I have to reach for a moisturizer. With a decent price, sold at a drugstore, by a line that focuses on oily, sensitive, acne-prone skin, the gel cleanser does it job.
faceoff_positive.headline: Good cleanser

faceoff_negative.comments: i have very bad acne prone oily skin and have struggle with my skin for years. I have heard so much about this brand so I decided to try it out. After about a week of using this my skin is very irritated and extremely dry and painful on my upper cheeks. I was so hopeful.
faceoff_negative.headline: Had high hopes

rollup.name: Effaclar Purifying Foaming Gel Cleanser for Oily Skin
